metadata.dc:author: Torres Gómez, F J
Torres Olivera, F J
García Escudero, A
metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVE The presence of signet ring cells within a transitional cell carcinoma is a factor of poor prognosis. METHODS We report the case of a 69-year-old male patient with the diagnosis of high grade transitional cell carcinoma with signet ring cell pattern, the presence of which could have been foreseen in serial cytological tests performed after the clinical debut. RESULTS To achieve such a diagnosis, it is necessary to rule out the possibility of metastasis or infiltration of a neoplasia from other organ. CONCLUSION Both the presence of an in situ neoplasia or the coexistence of infiltrative transitional cell tumor can help to determine primary origin of these neoplasias.
metadata.dc:title: Carcinoma urotelial de alto grado vesical con patrón de células "en anillo de sello". A propósito de un caso.
[High grade transitional cell carcinoma with signet ring cell pattern. Case report].
